meanings.definition: The act of exhaling air from the lungs.
meanings.sent1: After a deep breath, the doctor asked for three slow expirations.
meanings.sent2: Proper expirations are important for maintaining healthy lungs.
meanings.sent3: During the yoga class, the instructor joked about the loud expirations coming from the back row.
meanings.sent4: The wind carried the sound of the horse's expirations across the field.
meanings.sent5: The rhythmic expirations of the singer added to the beauty of the song.

meanings.definition: The end of a period of validity or duration.
meanings.sent1: The expirations of the passports meant they needed to be renewed soon.
meanings.sent2: The expirations of the coupons were clearly printed on the bottom.
meanings.sent3: The expirations of the library books caused a rush of returns at the end of the semester.
meanings.sent4: As the clock struck midnight, the expirations of the old year gave way to the new.
meanings.sent5: The expirations of the lease agreement led to negotiations for a new contract.

meanings.definition: The process of coming to an end or conclusion.
meanings.sent1: The expirations of the meeting signaled it was time to wrap up.
meanings.sent2: The expirations of the movie left the audience in suspense.
meanings.sent3: The expirations of the game brought both teams to a tense final moment.
meanings.sent4: The expirations of the story left readers wondering about the characters' fates.
meanings.sent5: The expirations of the performance left the audience wanting more.
